Name: OneConfigFile
column3: Yes/No. If " Yes", All DBs are combined. If "No", each DB will have its own files (one for each type)

Name: GeneratedConfigFileFolder
column3: Where generated config files will reside

Name: OneApsExportConfigFileName
column3: One file for this type for ALL DBs.

Name: OneSynapseObjectsConfigFileName
column3: One file for this type for ALL DBs.

Name: OneSynapseImportConfigFileName
column3: One file for this type for ALL DBs.

Name: OneSynapseExtTablesConfigFileName
column3: One file for this type for ALL DBs.

Name: ApsServerName
column3: Your APS server name and IP address

Name: ApsExportScriptsFolder
column3: Where the export scripts reside, and to be used for deployment.

Name: SynapseImportScriptsFolder
column3: Where the import scripts reside, and to be used for deployment.

Name: SynapseObjectScriptsFolder
column3: Where the Azure Synapse meta data SQL files reside (Tables, Views, and Stored Procedures, each type is under its own subdirectory

Name: SchemaFileFullPath
column3: Need this schema mapping file as well for information

Name: SynapseExternalTablesFolder
column3: Where the T-SQL Scripts reside for creating external tables inside Azure Synapse

Name: DropTruncateIfExistsFlag
column3: Sample Values: "DROP, TRUNCATE, NO". See step 6 readme.md (GitHub) for more details.

Name: OutputObjectsFolder
column3: Where the output files will be created when executing step 6 main program (PowerShell)

Name: Variables
column3: Sample: "@Location|TestLoc {Location}|TestLoc @Var1|TestLoc;@Var2 |Datasource". See step 6 readme.md (GitHub) for more details.
